Chapter 5 Optimization Basics 5.1 Linear regression as an optimization # generate data for a simple linear regression set.seed(20) n = 100 x <- cbind(1, rnorm(n)) y <- x %*% c(1, 0.5) + rnorm(n) # calculate the residual sum of squares for a grid of beta values rss <- function(b, x, y) sum((y - x %*% b)^2) b1 <- b2 <- seq(0, 2, length= 20) z = matrix(apply(expand.grid(b1, b2), 1, rss, x, y), 20, 20) # 3d plot for RSS par(mar = c(1,1,3,1)) persp(b1, b2, z, xlab = "beta 1", ylab = "beta 2", zlab = "RSS", main="Residual Sum of Squares", col = "springgreen", shade = 0.6, theta = 30, phi = 5) # The solution can be solved by any optimization algorithm optim(c(0, 0), rss, x = x, y = y)$par ## [1] 1.088813 0.679870
